name: Rungway
slogan: Rungway empowers employees to give and seek advice on work and life challenges
description:
Rungway provides a safe place for “always on” peer-to-peer support. Employees seek advice publicly or anonymously on their smartphone or desktop, and give bite-sized advice at their convenience. 

Imagine crowdsourcing the very best advice across your entire organisation, that’s Rungway!

Employees are empowered to support each other and grow professionally, increasing engagement levels. Businesses gain valuable talent insights into their workforce, from trending topics to workplace sentiment. This enables data-driven decisions to be made on talent and workplace culture. 

Headquartered in London, England, Rungway is the brainchild of successful businesswoman, Julie Chakraverty.

team.title: React Engineer
team.name: Ossie Nwokedi
team.bioHtml: Frontend web developer with experience with React and React Native, JavaScript, Typescript, HTML and CSS

team.name: Adam Edwards
team.bioHtml: Super awesome front-end developer, React ninja and CSS guru

jobs.title: Software Engineer: React
jobs.description:
Rungway:
We are an exciting London-based start-up, changing the way people give and get help, both at work and in life. Our platform empowers people to ask questions and give bite-sized advice to others. You can ask publicly, or anonymously. It’s really easy.

Everyone can benefit from our open community, and we also provide closed groups on a subscription basis to businesses who wish to provide their employees with “peer to peer” learning and support. Businesses using Rungway gain valuable talent insights into their workforce, from trending topics to workplace sentiment, improving talent and culture decisions through data.

When our users talk about Rungway, this is what they say:

- “A brilliant way to discreetly tap the best brains about career and life” Director, Sky
- “A safe environment for me to ask questions and get relevant advice. I’ve gotten so much wisdom, helping me make decisions and be better at what I do” Analyst, Barclays
- “Imagine if all of the insight and common experiences across the world of business could finally be shared - that’s why being on Rungway makes me so happy” - CEO, Decoded

Role:
Rungway are looking for an experienced React engineer to join our small team of engineers. You will work alongside some brilliant developers to extend and improve Rungway's platform, building beautiful and engaging experiences across desktop and mobile. From our office between Finchley Road and West Hampstead, you will help us build quality technical solutions to meaningful problems.

Skills Required:
- Extensive Javascript knowledge, including both vanilla and React
- Deep understanding of HTML5 & CSS, preferably with Sass
- Unit & integration testing experience
- Experience in Agile environments
- Excellent communication skills, and a team-player attitude. We win together
- You have an open mind and appetite for learning, coupled with a pragmatic and constructive approach to problem solving

Logistics:
Our interview process begins with a phone call, followed by an in-person interview with some of our team and some pair programming, and a final in-person interview with our senior management. We want to move quickly, so you'll hear from us if the process is progressing.

If we make you an offer, you can be sure of a competitive salary, stock options, and a fun office environment. Rungway practices what it preaches, and cares about building a workplace which is open, inclusive, and diverse.

Excited? So are we. We can't wait to hear from you.

jobs.title: Developer in Test
jobs.description:
Rungway
We are a London-based start-up, changing the way people give and get help, both at work and in life. Our platform empowers people to ask questions anonymously and give bite-sized advice to others. 

We provide closed groups on a subscription basis to businesses who wish to empower their employees to give peer-to-peer mentoring and support. Employees find a safe space for voicing concerns, raising issues, and finding the support they need to be healthier and happier at work.

Role
Are you a motivated and experienced Developer in Test, looking to help an exciting startup build upon their early success? Rungway are seeking an outstanding Developer in Test to join our growing team. You will work alongside our excellent front- and back-end teams to instil good testing practices, and you’ll work with the product team to ensure stories are well-defined and testable before we begin building them.

While there will always be a need for manual testing at Rungway, we see automation as vital to our ability to scale. You’ll set the benchmark for testing by owning our suite of system tests and the CI infrastructure that goes with them. 

Skills Required
- Experience running manual tests and writing integration / system tests for web apps, mobile apps, and APIs
- You are comfortable with Agile processes, and are keen to own testing throughout the product development lifecycle
- Excellent communication skills, and a team-player attitude
- You have an open mind and appetite for learning, coupled with a pragmatic and constructive approach to problem solving

Relevant Tech
These are the tools we currently use, and experience with some of these would be useful, but not essential:
Java 8, with Spock to write unit & integration tests
React, with Jest & Enzyme for testing
Our CI system is Jenkins running on AWS
Our system tests are currently written in Java, using Selenium, TestNG, & Rest Assured. You will own this, and we are open to revisiting this suite

Benefits
We’ll give you a fair salary based on your level of experience, plus stock options. You can choose which laptop and OS you want to run, and while you’ll have a desk in our lovely Farringdon office we’re happy for you to work from home one day a week. We hope you’ll find the office is a calm space that lets you get on with your work. 

We’ll be making some changes to our benefits package for 2019, so speak to us to find out more.

Logistics
Our interview process begins with a phone call, followed by an in-person interview with some of our team and some pair programming, and a final in-person interview with our senior management. We want to move quickly, so you'll hear from us if the process is progressing.

If we make you an offer, you can be sure of a competitive salary, stock options, and a great office environment. Rungway practices what it preaches, and cares about building a workplace which is open, inclusive, and diverse.

Excited? So are we. We can't wait to hear from you.

jobs.title: DevOps Engineer: Kubernetes, AWS
jobs.description:
Are you a motivated and experienced DevOps Engineer, looking to help an exciting startup build upon their early success? Rungway are seeking an outstanding candidate to join our growing team. You will be our second DevOps Engineer, and you’ll share the responsibility of building a scalable, reliable, and manageable infrastructure.

Our infrastructure is based on Linux, Docker, Kubernetes, and Terraform, deployed into AWS using CI/CD pipelines. The microservice backend and web frontend are maintained by our front- and back-end teams who you will work closely alongside. Since Rungway is a 24/7 platform, the role will require joining the on call rota. 

Skills Required
- Experience building customer-facing infrastructures on AWS using Kubernetes and Terraform
- Experience with Docker
- Excellent communication skills, and a team-player attitude
- Knowledge of a programming language, preferably Python or Java
- Experience with shell scripting (sh, bash)
- Practice implementing techniques for securing production infrastructures

Relevant Tech
These are the tools we currently use, and experience with some of these would be useful, but not essential:
- Jenkins, Nexus, WeaveWorks Flux
- Helm, KubeDB
- Prometheus, Grafana, Kibana, OpsGenie
- PostgreSQL, MongoDB, Elasticsearch

Benefits
We’ll give you a competitive salary based on your level of experience, plus stock options. You’ll have a budget each year to spend on training, and we operate a flexible time off policy meaning you can take as much leave as you need throughout the year. You can choose which laptop and OS you want to run, and while you’ll have a desk in our lovely Farringdon office we’re happy for you to work from home one day a week. We hope you’ll find the office is a calm space that lets you get on with your work. 

Logistics
Our interview process begins with a phone call, followed by an in-person interview with some of our team an exercise alongside one of our team. We want to move quickly, so you'll hear from us if the process is progressing.

If we make you an offer, you can be sure of a competitive salary, stock options, and a great office environment. Rungway practices what it preaches, and cares about building a workplace which is open, inclusive, and diverse.

Excited? So are we. We can't wait to hear from you.

jobs.title: Business Development Representative
jobs.description:
The opportunity

After successfully launching Rungway into a number of leading global organisations, we are now looking to scale our sales efforts to help more organisations develop their talent and transform their cultures. Rungway’s technology offer is unique and we’ve created a new segment. Our early sales hires need to have the right winning characteristics required to achieve our ambitious growth plan.

The successful Business Development Representative will helping to build the sales function with future opportunities to scale. You will be responsible for actively seeking out new sales leads and business opportunities through proactive prospecting, networking and utilizing business referrals. In partnership with the Rungway leadership team, you will be working across the C-Suite in some of the biggest companies in the world to identify and create solutions that help our clients succeed. For the right candidate, this is a transformative opportunity to help build a high growth business and your career in the process. You will work closely with our founder, a main board member of a major UK bank and high profile business leader, so this is a real opportunity for unique coaching and career impact for the ambitious candidate.

We want the best

We’re looking for passionate self-starters who enjoy diving head-first into new challenges. You’ll need to be adaptive and excited at the opportunity to help create new processes, improve on what’s already been built, and interact with our amazing customers on a daily basis. 


You’ll be a great fit if you can...

Generate qualified leads with executives up to C-Suite across FTSE/ enterprise businesses through outbound prospecting strategies. 
Develop best practices around pipeline creation, conversion rates, forecasting accuracy, and cross-functional collaboration.
Use your persuasive verbal and written communication skills, excellent email writing and telephone skills with a high level of attention to detail to effectively communicate Rungway’s value (you will need a quick mind to assess information and influence C-suite buyers).
Demonstrate success in understanding business objectives and exceeding goals.
You are someone who pursues your goals with energy, commitment, and process
Sell SaaS, software sales, technology sales, and/or HR solutions.
Work with a CRM system to help drive the sales cycle.
Execute a work ethic that is second to none and be client-focused and highly responsive.


Interested? Here’s some helpful questions to consider

Will I relish the challenge of creating a new market as a founding employee of an exciting new company, without the resources or known brand of larger competitors?
Do I have the motivation and passion to work tirelessly in the pursuit of new market creation? Do I understand what this takes?
Do I understand why people buy at different levels of a large Enterprise? Can I qualify the difference between different types of supporter? 
Do I have a proven understanding of sales process and past experience of successfully qualifying leads? Do I take pride in constantly measuring, improving and scaling a sales process in order to achieve great results?


About Rungway
Businesses using Rungway can understand and solve problems earlier, and gain unique culture insights. When our clients talk about Rungway, this is what they say:

There is no greater value to me as a manager, friend, and colleague, than having the opportunity to truly listen to, and hear, concerns and questions that my co-workers are grappling with. I have learned more via Rungway than I have in nearly any other avenue. It creates a safe, positive, helping community. 

Global Managing Partner, Heidrick & Struggles

We launched Rungway following feedback that some of our juniors were not getting the support they needed from their immediate line manager when they needed it. The idea was why be limited to just one manager when you could access advice from hundreds. So much of culture lies under the surface – but Rungway helps bring issues into the open. I highly recommend it. 

Managing Director, Head of Culture and Client Marketing, UBS Investment Bank

Culture is a top priority for us. We already use employee surveys and chat systems. Rungway allows individual, anonymous questions, and is very different. It sends a message that whoever you are, whatever your role or location, your voice matters. 

CEO, Standard Life Aberdeen

jobs.title: Insights Analyst
jobs.description:
Rungway’s peer to peer advice platform helps companies build more inclusive and connected cultures. The customer success team is pivotal in helping our customers benefit from the value Rungway offers through the platform, insights, and moderation to make data-driven decisions on talent and culture.


You will work closely across multiple teams to deliver analysis, visualisation, and research for customers. Our goal is to help customers feel and be successful through every interaction with Rungway.

You will be:
- Analysing Rungway data to build compelling insights and learnings for our customers.
- Helping build dashboards and content in the form of presentations, reports, and research papers across customers and sectors that will have up to CxO level visibility.
- Working with sales, product, and marketing to help build our insights-driven user-facing content (e.g. newsletters, blogs, user documentation, sales, and marketing material).
- Building repeatable processes to deliver scalable insights.

Success in the role longer term will be to help define and scale Rungway impact through data and to shape how our customers think about culture measurement.


What will help you get there? 
- Strong written and verbal communication with different audiences (e.g. technical and non-technical).
- Advanced Excel skills and proficient in Google Sheets.
- Passionate about building solutions and processes as Rungway grows.
- Technical skills with some of the following tools; Python, R, Dashboards and visualisation tools, (e.g. Kibana, Tableau).
- An analytical degree in Statistics, Engineering, Mathematics, Sciences or Economics or equivalent experience.

What’s the Rungway team like?
Rungway is all about people and culture. Our team comes from all over the world, from many types of industries, and we're inspired by building something that unlocks advice and support for everyone.
People seeking purpose and ownership in their work, within a fun and sharing culture, thrive at Rungway.  Our team boasts a wealth of experience from some of the world’s best-known brands such as LinkedIn, Uber, UBS, Live Nation, and Idio. 

Come and join us, make a meaningful impact and have fun doing it. www.rungway.com.
